hotspots.title: SD card slot
hotspots.description: Insert a SD card into the SD card slot with the gold contact pins side facing up, until it clicks into place.

hotspots.title: ESD strap ground point
hotspots.description:
Electrostatic discharge (ESD) damage can occur if components are mishandled.
Always wear an ESD-preventive wrist or ankle strap and always connect the ESD strap to the grounding plug on the front of the chassis.

hotspots.title: AC PSU
hotspots.description:
Rated voltage (AC): 100 to 240 VAC
Operating Voltage Range (AC): 90 to 264 VAC

hotspots.title: DC PSU
hotspots.description:
Rated voltage: 20 to 60 VDC
Operating Voltage Range (DC): 20 to 60 VDC

hotspots.title: Air filter
hotspots.description: Blocks solid particulates, such as dust.

hotspots.title: Management port
hotspots.description: Used to configure, maintain, and support the network device.

hotspots.title: Console port
hotspots.description: Used to plug the console cable.

hotspots.title: Ground Point
hotspots.description:
Grounding wires are NOT PROVIDED with the 7250 IXR-e chassis.
You must use a minimum of #8 AWG wire for the ground connection.

hotspots.title: General info
hotspots.description:
2 people for the installation: To prevent injury or damage to the chassis, it is recommended that two people remove the chassis from the shipping box and mount it into a rack.
Weight of 7250 IXR-e Big GNSS: 3.9 kg (8.6 lbs)
Temperature: -40 to 65Â°C.
Humidity: 5 to 95%.

steps.title: Step 1: position the chassis on the rack
Step 2: tighten the chassis screws to specification
Step 3: remove grounding screws
Step 4: attach grounding cable
Step 5: fix grounding screws
Step 6: attach ESD protection to the device
Step 7: wear ESD protection
Step 8: insert the AC PSU in one of the slots
Step 9: tighten the AC PSU captive screws
Step 10: install the AC power unit
Step 11: attach the AC power cable to the AC PSU
Step 12: insert the DC PSU in the slot
Step 13: tighten the DC PSU captive screws
Step 14: install the DC power unit on the rail
Step 15: attach the DC power cable to the DC PSU
Step 16: insert the airfilter in the slot
Step 17: tighten the filter captive screws
Step 18: insert the SD card in the PC
Step 19: install the software
Step 20: safely remove SD and insert it in the chassis
Step 21: connect the serial cable to the PC
Step 22: connect the serial cable to the chassis console port
Step 23: switch on the AC power
Step 24: switch on the DC power
